title: Easy DIY Worm Farm | Worm Farming for Beginners | Worm Farm Anywhere | Hey It's A Good Life

subtasks: Gather bedding materials (soil, compost, sphagnum peat moss, cocoa coir).
Obtain worms (e.g., from Uncle Jim's worm farm).
Collect carbon source (dried leaves, shredded paper, cardboard).
Assemble food scraps (including fruits, vegetables, juice scraps).
Include grit (coffee grounds, eggshells, oyster shells).
Prepare a bin (e.g., storage tote), ensuring proper aeration.
Layer materials in the bin (bedding, leaves, food scraps, grit).
Ensure proper drainage to prevent drowning.
Breaking down food scraps and bedding materials.
Sealing the bin with a lid and ventilation holes.
Participation in online forums (Facebook group, Instagram).
